comment.body:
> [dldx](#comment_2_12aUNK5oaVy24PUFxevXvh63iDvVyncGHx): I've been doing the same with a raspberry pi. The only problem is that people keep linking to 127.0.0.1:43110 when they link to a zeronet site which obviously doesn't work unless you do port forwarding. There are a couple of plugins for chrome that help but nothing that's perfect yet.

Doesn't the JavaScript automagically convert the links for you? I almost never have this "link-to-localhost problem" -- while I do run ZeroNet node on an ARM board (a separate host on the LAN).
